caller_intent: Kobe is checking on the status of an insurance quote for Jupiter LLC, a new startup, and inquiring about the ETA for General Liability (GL) coverage and potential excess liability options.
resolution_steps: Joe confirms he has received all necessary documents (contracts, resumes) and is finalizing the GL quote.
He explains that excess liability cannot be quoted immediately due to Jupiter LLC's new venture status, suggesting a one-year waiting period.
Proposes a higher GL limit (up to $2M) as a temporary workaround, acknowledging the risk of the startup's uncertain future operations.
Advises Kobe to focus on securing GL coverage first and to wait until Jupiter LLC establishes contracts and clarifies their niche before addressing excess liability.
knowledge_required: Underwriting guidelines for new ventures in commercial insurance
GL and excess liability coverage parameters
Risk assessment for startups with uncertain operational scope
systems_referenced: Internal email system (update sent to Kendall)
Carrier portals for GL quote setup
summary: Joe updates Kobe on the GL quote for Jupiter LLC, explaining delays in excess liability due to the startup's new status. He suggests a higher GL limit as a temporary measure and recommends waiting until the company establishes contracts and clarifies its niche. The call ends with mutual agreement to follow up after Jupiter LLC gains more operational stability.
